ul.li: What you do on first of the month

example.title: Example Simple List With an Admonition
example.p: For each message returned, the components of the response are presented in the following order:

ul.li: Receipt handle The receipt handle is the identifier you must provide when deleting the message (for more information, see Queue and Message Identifiers). You received the message ID when you sent the message to the queue. For information about MD5, go to http://faqs.org/rfcs/rfc1321.html).
MD5 digest of the message body

example.p: For each message returned, the components of the response are presented in the following order:

ul.li:
Receipt handle
The receipt handle is the identifier you must provide when deleting the message (for more information, see Queue and Message Identifiers). You received the message ID when you sent the message to the queue. For information about MD5, go to http://faqs.org/rfcs/rfc1321.html).
MD5 digest of the message body

example.p: For each message returned, the components of the response are presented in the following order:

ul.li: MD5 digest of the message body

example.note: The receipt handle is the identifier you must provide when deleting the message (for more information, see Queue and Message Identifiers). You received the message ID when you sent the message to the queue. For information about MD5, go to http://faqs.org/rfcs/rfc1321.html).
